pullRequest.title: Fix #6117, #5776, #74: Update FullCalendar to v5.1.0
pullRequest.bodyText:
This updates FullCalendar to version 5.1.0, see #5776
For the release notes:

FullCalendar uses a different DOM structure with potentially new or changed style classes, check your custom CSS if you have any.
If you are using a custom extender function, check your JavaScript code as many FullCalendar settings have been renamed or changed (see the FullCalendar upgrade guide: https://fullcalendar.io/docs/upgrading-from-v4)
The event interface contains two new methods ScheduleEvent#isResizable and ScheduleEvent#isDraggable that should be used instead of ScheduleEvent#isEditable. Likewise, the builder has DefaultScheduleEvent.Builder#resizable and DefaultScheduleEvent.Builder#draggable.

Remarks


The Schedule component options resizable and draggable never had any effect because they were always overwritten by the isEditable() property on the ScheduleEvent. Also, editable is just a shortcut for resizable and draggable - but why can you set these individually on the component but not on the event? I changed it so that there is a isResizable() and isDraggable() on ScheduleEvent that is of type Boolean (null meaning that the default of the component is used). isEditable() is now deprecated. I also added two method resizable and draggable to the DefaultScheduleEvent.Builder.


Some themes include custom CSS for FullCalendar. For the most part, everything still looks well. There's one minor issue - the colors in the list view are wrong e.g. for the nova theme. This repo only contains the minified CSS for the themes, not sure where the original sources are. If anybody could update the themes, that would be great.



(^ The background color of the rows should be grey - also, on hover, the background turns grey and is almost unrecognizable.)

commit.message: Schedule: Initial update to FullCalendar v5 (#5776)
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/primefaces/primefaces into issue-5776-fullcalendarv5
implement #5776: Update FullCalendar to v5, tested against showcase

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -54,8 +54,8 @@ showWeekNumbers | false | Boolean | Display week numbers in schedule.
 extender | null | String | Name of JavaScript function to extend the options of the underlying FullCalendar plugin.
 displayEventEnd | null | String | Whether or not to display an event's end time text when it is rendered on the calendar. Value can be a boolean to globally configure for all views or a comma separated list such as "month:false,basicWeek:true" to configure per view.
 weekNumberCalculation | local | String | The method for calculating week numbers that are displayed. Valid values are "local"(default), "ISO" and "custom".
-weekNumberCalculator | null | String | Client side function to use in custom weekNumberCalculation.
-nextDayThreshold | 09:00:00 | String | When an event's end time spans into another day, the minimum time it must be in order for it to render as if it were on that day. Default is 09:00:00.
+weekNumberCalculator | null | String | Client side function to use in custom `weekNumberCalculation`. This must be a JavaScript expression that results in an integer week number. You can use the local variable `date`, which points to the `Date` object for which the week number is to be determined. To illustrate, if you were to specify `date.getFullYear()`, the year would be shown instead of the actual week number.  
+nextDayThreshold | 09:00:00 | String | When an event's end time spans into another day, the minimum time it must be in order for it to render as if it were on that day. Default is `09:00:00`.
 slotEventOverlap | true | Boolean | If true contemporary events will be rendered one overlapping the other, else they will be rendered side by side.

commit.message: Schedule: #5776 Update thirdpartylibs.md, expand JavaDocs on draggable/resizable

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/primefaces/primefaces into issue-5776-fullcalendarv5

* Also add the two missing <T> generics on draggable and resizable
Schedule: #74 Synchronize event#allDay with the server on eventMove
